title: Lawyers: Feds seek 'eye for eye' from NYC bike path killer
description: Lawyers for a man convicted of killing eight people along a Manhattan bike path five years ago say prosecutors are unfairly using emotional testimony from victims' families to try to win a death penalty ruling from a jury

title: Project Veritas founder James O'Keefe out at right-wing org
description: Project Veritas founder James O’Keefe said in a speech posted online Monday that he has been removed as the right-wing group’s leader

title: WATCH:  Dogs and their humans celebrate carnival in Brazil
description: These pups put on their best disguises at a canine carnival celebration in Rio de Janeiro.

title: WATCH:  5-year-old earthquake survivor surprised with birthday cake
description: Volunteers surprised a Turkish girl named Berfin with a cake and candles to celebrate her fifth birthday.

title: String of deadly shootings across the nation mar holiday weekend
description: Shootings across the nation has marred the Presidents Day weekend as law enforcement officers in major cities and rural areas investigated separate violent episodes.

title: Brazil deluge kills 36; search continues for dozens missing
description: Hundreds of rescuers in Brazil are searching for survivors of landslides and flooding that killed at least 36 people along the coast of the country’s southern state of Sao Paulo following a huge weekend downpour

title: New 6.4 earthquake strikes Turkey as death toll climbs to nearly 47,000
description: Turkey was hit with another earthquake Monday night, according to officials.

title: Three killed, including baby, in Chicago highway shooting
description: Police in Illinois say three people have died and three more were hurt after a shooting on a Chicago interstate highway

title: Body of Ghana soccer player Atsu repatriated from Turkey
description: The body of Ghana soccer player Christian Atsu has been repatriated after he was found dead in his collapsed apartment building in the Turkey earthquake

title: DA drops most severe charge against Alec Baldwin in 'Rust' shooting
description: The Santa Fe District Attorney's Office announced it is dropping the gun enhancement charge against Alec Baldwin in the "Rust" shooting.

title: Woman caught on video setting fire to gay pride flag outside restaurant
description: New York City police are searching for the woman seen on video setting fire to a gay pride flag in front of a Manhattan restaurant.

title: US told Russia to Biden's surprise trip to Ukraine just before he arrived: Officials
description: Biden administration officials shared some of the details behind the president's unannounced trip to Kyiv, Ukraine, ahead of the anniversary of Russia's invasion

title: Record number of guns intercepted at airport security
description: Last year saw a record number of guns intercepted at airport checkpoints across the country

title: FDA’s own reputation could be restraining its misinfo fight
description: The Food and Drug Administration is taking aim at online misinformation.

title: Putin may meet top Chinese party official on Moscow trip
description: Vladimir Putin could meet with the Chinese Communist Party foreign policy chief.

title: Meta announces verification subscription service for Facebook, Instagram
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced on Sunday that the company will begin testing a new paid subscription service on its platforms amid sluggish revenue growth.

title: 5th person confirmed to be cured of HIV
description: Researchers are announcing that a 53-year-old man in Germany has been cured of HIV.

title: Russia sells weapons at Abu Dhabi arms fair amid Ukraine war
description: Russia is offering weapons for sale ranging from Kalashnikov assault rifles to missile systems despite facing sanctions from the West over its war on Ukraine

title: Russian pranksters call Merkel posing as Ukraine's ex-leader
description: Russian pranksters posing as Ukraine’s ex-President Petro Poroshenko managed to contact Angela Merkel by phone to discuss developments in Ukraine and Belarus, although the former German chancellor appeared wary during the call

title: Ohio train derailment: Buttigieg pens sharply worded letter to Norfolk Southern
description: U.S. Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg penned a sharply worded letter to Norfolk Southern Railway president and CEO Alan Shaw on Sunday.

title: Japan to give Ukraine $5.5B, host online G-7 plus Zelenskyy
description: Japan’s Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has announced a new $5.5 billion financial aid for Ukraine and will mark the first anniversary of the war by hosting an online Group of Seven summit with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

title: Tatum scores All-Star record 55, Team Giannis wins 184-175
description: Jayson Tatum put on a record-setting show, and made Giannis Antetokounmpo look like a genius

title: 'People's court' tries Vladimir Putin for war in Ukraine
description: A “people’s court” is putting Russian President Vladimir Putin on trial for the crime of aggression over his invasion of Ukraine, in a symbolic move to close an “accountability gap” in the absence of an international tribunal with jurisdiction

title: Biden arrives in Kyiv on surprise visit, signaling 'unflagging commitment' to Ukraine
description: President Joe Biden on Monday made an unannounced visit to Ukraine, arriving in Kyiv as the United States’ signals its ongoing support in the fight against Russia.

title: Putin's Ukraine gamble seen as biggest threat to his rule
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's gamble to invade Ukraine a year ago seems to have backfired spectacularly

title: 1 dead, 4 injured in shooting at New Orleans parade before Mardi Gras
description: Five people were shot at the Krewe of Bacchus Parade in New Orleans Sunday evening, according to New Orleans Police Chief Deputy Hans Ganthier.

title: 26 dead amid heavy rains in Brazil, cities cancel Carnival
description: There were floods and landslides in north Sao Paulo state.

title: A timeline of President Jimmy Carter’s recent health challenges
description: Former President Jimmy Carter, who is receiving hospice care at home after a series of short hospital stays, has had several health issues in recent years.

title: Oakland airport, 50K in Bay Area lose power due to fire
description: About 50,000 utility customers in the San Francisco Bay Area were without power.

title: Meta testing new subscription service for verified accounts
description: Meta is testing a new subscription service that would let Facebook and Instagram users pay for a verified account

title: Buttigieg warns Norfolk Southern to support Ohio community
description: The freight rail company must “demonstrate unequivocal support," he said.
